item.title: Joy add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Joy add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Joy add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Joy add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "A painter should begin every canvas with a wash of black, because all things in nature are dark except where exposed by the light." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Joy add a quote by Kate Morton
item.description: "Memory is a cruel mistress with whom we all must learn to dance." -- Kate Morton

item.title: Joy add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Never forget what you are, for surely the world will not. Make it your strength. Then it can never be your weakness. Armour yourself in it, and it will never be used to hurt you." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Joy add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Joy add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Joy add a quote by Mickey from Dr Who
item.description: "I'm the tin dog!" -- Mickey from Dr Who

item.title: Joy add a quote by Jane Yolen
item.description: "Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood." -- Jane Yolen

item.title: Joy add a quote by Mary & Marshall from In Plain Sight
item.description:
"Marshall: You're like I have a pet cannibal. Half the time I'm protecting you from the world. The other half of the time I'm protecting the world from you.
Mary: Sorry . . . but that's your job!" -- Mary & Marshall from In Plain Sight

item.title: Joy add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Do you want to die old and craven in your bed?- How else? Though not till I'm done reading." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Joy add a quote by George R. R. Martin
item.description: "oh, don't look so aggrieved. I have never met a man I didn't provoke" ~ Asha Greyjoy (from a Feast For Crows)" -- George R. R. Martin

item.title: Joy add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "I don't want to have a dozen sons," she had told him, appalled. "I want to have <i>adventures" ~Asha Greyjoy" -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Joy add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "she would die as she had lived, with an axe in her hand and a laugh upon her lips." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Joy add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Joy add a quote by Alison Goodman
item.description: "There was a saying that a man's true character was revealed in defeat. I thought it was also revealed in victory." -- Alison Goodman

item.title: Joy add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "And Vin liked solitude. When you're alone, no one can betray you" -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Joy add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "That's it, said Cavuto. You're too much of a nerd to be gay. I'm contacting the committee. They'll revoke your rainbow flag and you will not be permitted anywhere near the parade." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Joy add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "He started skipping, but then caught himself and returned to deliberately pacing out his steps with his sheathed sword. People might ignore a tiny Japanese man in an orange porkpie hat and socks, with a sword, but if you went around expressing unrestrained joy, they would have you in a straightjacket before you could belt out a verse of "Zippity Do-Dah." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Joy add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "I've always been very confident in my immaturity." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Joy add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "Elend: I kind of lost track of time… Breeze: For two hours? Elend: There were books involved." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Joy add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "It was amazing how many books one could fit into a room, assuming one didn't want to move around very much." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Joy add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "You hate change. I hate it too. But things can't stay the same- and that's well, for when nothing changes in your life, it's as good as being dead" -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Joy add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "Elend smiled. "Oh, come on. You have to admit that you're unusual, Vin. You're like some strange mixture of a noblewoman, a street urchin, and a cat. Plus, you've mangaged - in our short three years together - to kill not only my god, but my father, my brother, <i>and</i> my fiancée. That's kind of like a homicidal hat trick." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Joy add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "Lately, I feel like my life is a book written in a language I don't know how to read." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Joy add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "If no one in the entire world cared about you, did you really exist at all?" -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Joy add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "One must always be careful of books," said Tessa, "and what is inside them, for words have the power to change us." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Joy add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Sometimes, when I have to do something I don't want to do, I pretend I'm a character from a book. It's easier to know what they would do." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Joy add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "There was a man who was worthless, and knew he was worthless, and yet however far down he tried to sink his soul, there was always some part of him capable of great action." -- Cassandra Clare
